questions.question: The operating mass of an aircraft is:
options: a. the dry operating mass plus the take-off fuel mass.
b. the empty mass plus the take-off fuel mass.
c. the empty mass plus crew, crew baggage and catering.
d. the empty mass plus the trip fuel mass.

questions.question: What effect has a centre of gravity close to the forward limit?
options: a. a better rate of climb capability.
b. a reduction in the specific fuel consumption.
c. a reduced rate of climb for a particular flight path.

questions.question: The DOM of an aeroplane is:
options: c. useful load minus operating mass.

questions.question: The traffic load of an aeroplane is:
options: c. useful load minus operating mass.

questions.question: Where is the reference datum?
options: a. 74 inches aft of the fwd CG position
b. 80.4 inches aft of the rear CG position
c. 87.7 inches aft of the rear CG position
d. 39 inches forward of the firewall

questions.question: What are the CG limits?
options: a. fwd limit = 74 inches to 80.4 inches
b. fwd limit = 74 inches, aft limit = 80.4 inches
c. fwd limit = 74 inches, aft limit = 87.7 inches
d. fwd limit = 74 inches to 80.4 inches and aft limit = 87.7 inches

questions.question: What is the CG at the BEM?
What is the structural load limit for the floor at baggage zone 'C'?
What is the distance of the main undercarriage from the firewall?
The aircraft has six seats. Assuming no other cargo or baggage, what is the maximum fuel that can be carried if all six seats are occupied and the mass of each occupant is 180 lb?
options: a. 50 lb but the CG would be dangerously out of limits
b. 155 lb but the CG would be dangerously out of limits
c. 50 lb and the CG would be in limits
d. 155 lb and the CG would be in limits

questions.question: Where is the centroid of baggage zone B?
Assuming the weight and access is not a problem, where can a box of mass 500 lb be positioned if the dimensions are 0.75 ft x 1.5 ft x 5 ft:
options: a. In any of the baggage zones if placed on its smallest area
b. In zones 'B' or 'C' if placed on its largest area
c. In zone 'C' only if placed on its middle area
d. In zone 'A' only if placed on its largest area

questions.question: Assuming the weight and access is not a problem, where can a cubic box of mass 500 lb be positioned if the dimensions are 3.15 ft?
options: a. In any of the baggage zones

questions.question: If the landing mass is 3155 lb and the trip fuel was 40 gallons, what was the ZFM if the fuel tanks held 60 gallons of fuel prior to take-off?
What is the maximum ramp mass?
How far is the main wheel from the aft CG limit?
options: a. 0.7 inches behind the rear datum
b. 0.7 inches forward of the rear datum
c. 6.6 inches forward of the rear datum
d. 9.3 inches aft of the rear datum

questions.question: How far is the firewall from the fuel tank centroid?
If the total moment is less than the minimum moment allowed:
options: a. useful load items must be shifted aft
b. useful load items must be shifted forward
c. forward load items must be increased
d. aft load items must be reduced

questions.question: The CG is on the lower of the fwd CG limits:
options: a. at a mass of 2500 lb and moment of 185 000 lb in
b. at a moment of 175 000 lb in and a mass of 2365 lb
c. at a moment of 192000 lb in and a mass of 2594 lb

questions.question: What performance class does the aircraft belong to?
Where is the reference datum?
options: a. 78.4 inches forward of the wing leading edge at the inboard edge of the inboard fuel tank
b. 25.3 inches forward of the nose wheel
c. 109.8 inches forward of the main wheel

questions.question: The main wheel is:
options: a. 19 inches forward of the fwd CG limit at the maximum take-off mass
b. 27.8 inches behind the fwd CG limit at a take-off mass of 3400 lb
c. 15.2 inches forward of the rear CG limit at the maximum take-off mass

questions.question: The nose wheel is:
options: a. 56.7 inches forward of the fwd CG limit at maximum take-off mass
b. 65.5 inches forward of the fwd CG limit at maximum take-off mass
c. 69.3 inches aft of the rear CG limit at maximum take-off mass

questions.question: What is the minimum fuel mass that must be consumed if the aircraft, having become airborne at maximum weight, decides to abort the flight?
If the pilot has a mass of 200 lb, what is the maximum traffic load?
Assuming the maximum zero fuel mass and maximum take-off mass, what fuel load can be carried?
options: d. Any one of the above

questions.question: A box of mass 100 lb is to be transported. The box dimensions are 9 x 9 x 12 inches. Which zones can it be carried in?
options: a. All zones, both the mass and structural loading are within limits
c. No zones, both the mass and structural loading would be exceeded
d. No zones, the structural loading would be exceeded

questions.question: A box of mass 360 lb is to be transported. The dimensions of the box are 1.7 ft x 1.7 ft x 1.8 ft. Which zones can it be carried in?
options: a. Zones 2 and 3 only but placed on the 1.7 x 1.7 face
b. Zones 2 and 3 only but placed on the 1.7 x 1.8 face
c. No zones, both the mass and structural loading would be exceeded
d. No zones, the structural loading would be exceeded

questions.question: Assuming floor loading limits are acceptable, how much freight and fuel load can be carried for MSTOM if the pilot's mass was 200 lb?
options: a. A full load in each zone plus 380 lb of fuel
b. 50 lb in zones 1 or 4 but full loads in each of the other zones, plus 280 lb of fuel
c. 350 lb load in zone 4 but full loads in all the other zones, plus 280 lb of fuel
d. A full freight load in each zone plus 280 lb of fuel

questions.question: What is the maximum fuel tank capacity?
If the aircraft is at MSTOM with full fuel tanks and a pilot of mass 200 lb, what traffic load can be carried?
options: b. 579 lb providing at least 20.5 gallons of fuel are consumed in start, taxi and flight
c. 625 lb providing at least 43.3 gallons of fuel are consumed in start, taxi and flight
d. 759 lb providing at least 59.5 gallons of fuel are consumed in start, taxi and flight

questions.question: The CG when the TOM is 4300 lb and the corresponding moment is 408 500 lb in is:
options: d. 0.6 inches rear of the aft limit

questions.question: If the CG is 86 inches and the TOM is 4100 lb the aircraft is:
options: a. just on the forward CG limit
b. just outside the forward CG limit
c. just inside the aft CG limit
d. within the two forward limits

questions.question: What is the total length of the fuselage?
How far is the front spar from the datum?
What is the distance between the two main access doors?
How far is the leading edge of the mean aerodynamic chord from the datum?
options: a. 540 inches forward of the datum
b. 589.5 inches forward of the datum
c. 625.6 inches aft of the datum
d. 627.5 inches aft of the datum

questions.question: What is the length of the mean aerodynamic chord?
What moment change occurs when the flaps are fully retracted from the 15 degree position?
What change in moment occurs when the flaps are retracted from 40 degrees to 5 degrees?
options: a. A negative moment of 5 kg.in
b. A negative moment of 11 kg.in
c. A negative moment of 16 kg.in
d. A negative moment of 5000 kg.in

questions.question: What stabilizer trim setting is required for take-off when the CG is 19% MAC for 5 degrees of take-off flap?
What is the maximum structural take-off mass?
What is the CG range for maximum zero fuel mass?
Assuming the MZFM, what is the maximum allowable fuel mass for take-off?
Assuming the standard masses have been used for both passengers and baggage, what is the mass of a full passenger and baggage load?
What is the allowable hold baggage load for an aircraft with a full passenger complement?
What is the underload if only maximum passenger hold baggage is carried?
If the crew mass is 450 kg and the Zero Fuel Mass is 51 300 kg, what is the Basic Empty Mass if a full traffic load is carried?
Using the values for the data given in the Loading Manual, would the aircraft be able to carry both a full fuel load and a full traffic load at take-off?
options: b. Yes, providing the BEM was not more than 31 145 kg.
c. Yes, providing the BEM was not less than 31 451 kg.
d. Yes, providing the BEM was not more than 31 514 kg.

questions.question: If the DOM is given as 34300 kg and the aircraft has a full load of passengers and baggage, what additional cargo mass could it carry i.e. what is the underload?
What is the maximum usable fuel quantity?
What is the maximum usable fuel mass?
What is the allowable start and taxi fuel?
What are the preferred zones for passenger loads if the pax load is low?
options: a. Zones E, F and G.
b. Zones C, D and E.
c. Zones B, C and D.

questions.question: How many seats are there in zone B?
The leading edge of the MAC is given as 625.6 inches aft of the datum. What is the distance of the CG from the datum if it is found to be 16% of the MAC?
The CG is found to be 652.5 inches aft of the datum. What percentage is the CG of the MAC?

If a passenger moves from a seat position corresponding to the balance arm at zone D to a position corresponding to the balance arm at zone F, what distance will the passenger have travelled and how many seat rows will he have passed?
The balance arm for each of the seat zones is measured from the datum to:
options: a. the front border line of the zone.
b. the centre line of the zone.
c. the rear border line of the zone.
d. the front border line of the next zone in sequence.

questions.question: What is the maximum and minimum running load of a box of mass 500 kg and dimensions of 1 m x 1.2 m x 1.2 m?
What is the maximum and minimum distribution load intensity for a box of mass 500 kg and dimensions of 1 m x 1.2 m x 1.2 m?
options: a. 50.5 kg/sq ft and 40.6 kg/sq ft.
b. 47.3 kg/sq ft and 37.7 kg/sq ft.
c. 45.1 kg/sq ft and 35.8 kg/sq ft.

questions.question: All other parameters being acceptable, a box with a maximum and minimum running load of 12 kg/in and 7 kg/in and a mass of 800 kg can be fitted into:
options: a. any compartment of either the forward or aft cargo compartment.
b. the front section of the aft cargo compartment or the rear section of the forward cargo compartment.
c. the rear section of the forward cargo compartment or the rear section of the aft cargo compartment.
d. the centre section of the forward cargo compartment only.

questions.question: A box with a mass of 500 kg and dimensions 0.8 m and 0.9 m x 1.3 m has a maximum and minimum distribution load intensity of:
options: a. 64.6 kg/sq ft max and 39.7 kg/sq ft min.
b. 39.7 kg/sq ft max and 64.6 kg/sq ft min.
c. 4.7 kg/sq ft max and 39.7 kg/sq ft min.
d. 64.6 kg/sq ft max and 44.7 kg/sq ft min.

questions.question: The maximum freight mass allowed is:
Assuming all other parameters are acceptable, a box with a mass of 500 kg and with equal sides of 8.5 ft would fit into:
options: a. either the front or rear cargo compartment.
b. the forward cargo compartment only.
d. the aft cargo compartment only.

questions.question: The front compartment of the front cargo hold is situated below:
The balance arm of the centroid of the forward hold compartment is:
options: b. midway between 228 inches and 286 inches.
c. midway between 286 inches and 343 inches.

questions.question: The maximum distribution load intensity for the cargo compartments is:
Between 44000 kg and 63000 kg the rear CG limit as a percentage of the MAC:
The traffic load is:
options: a. 39 800 kg obtained from ZFM, 51 300 kg less fuel mass 11500 kg.
b. obtained from the sum of pax mass plus baggage mass plus total cargo compartment mass.
c. 13 370 kg obtained from 10920 kg pax mass plus 2450 kg baggage mass plus 630 kg cargo mass.
d. 13 370 kg obtained from 10920 kg pax mass, 1820 kg baggage mass and 630 kg cargo mass.

questions.question: The cargo distribution in section 4 is:
The actual take-off mass is:
options: a. 51 300 kg ZFM plus 14500 kg take-off fuel.
b. 62 800 kg less 8500 kg trip fuel.
c. 53 670 kg less 14500 kg take-off fuel.
d. 47 670 kg ZFM plus 14500 kg take-off fuel mass.

questions.question: The landing mass is:
options: a. 62 800 kg take-off mass less 8500 kg trip fuel.
b. 62 170 kg take-off mass less 8500 kg trip fuel.
c. 62 170 kg take-off mass plus 8500 kg trip fuel.
d. 62 800 kg take-off mass plus 8500 kg trip fuel.

questions.question: In order to determine the underload the pilot starts by selecting the lowest mass from the three key masses given. The key masses are:
options: a. maximum zero fuel mass, take-off mass and landing mass.
b. dry operating mass, maximum zero fuel mass and take-off mass.
c. dry operating mass, maximum zero fuel mass and landing mass.
d. traffic load, take-off mass and landing mass.

questions.question: From the figures given, if the actual take-off fuel mass (14 500 kg) was added to the Maximum Zero Fuel Mass the aircraft would be:
options: a. below the maximum take-off mass by 350 kg.
b. over the maximum take-off mass by 530 kg.
c. over the maximum take-off mass by 3000 kg.
d. below the maximum take-off mass by 630 kg.

questions.question: The actual underload for the aircraft after the traffic load and fuel load have been accounted for is:
What is the Dry Operating Index?
What are the seat row numbers in pax zone 'Oc'?
What is the Take-off Mass as a percentage of the MAC?
Prior to take-off there is a change in destination and so the pilot decides to take 2000 kg of fuel less. Using the Load and Trim Sheet, calculate the new Take-off Mass and CG position:
options: a. can not be calculated because the landing mass will be too high.
b. 60 800 kg take-off mass and CG 17.5% MAC.
c. 60 170 kg take-off mass and CG 18.8% MAC.
d. 60 170 kg take-off mass and 19.3% MAC.

questions.question: When adjusting the CG index for the fuel load, why is the line moved to the left as a minus index?
options: a. Because the fuel will be consumed in flight.
b. Because the fuel is given a minus index in the fuel index correction table.
c. Because the centroid of the tanks is behind the CG position.
d. Because the graph would run out of range.

questions.question: For a fuel mass of 11 800 kg the index is:

A scheduled flight of three hours estimated flight time, within Europe, is being planned. Calculate the maximum mass of freight that may be loaded in the following circumstances:
Structural limited take-off mass: 62 800 kg
Structural limited landing mass: 54900 kg
MZFM: 51 300 kg
Dry Operating Mass: 34960 kg
Fuel on board at ramp: 5800 kg
Taxi fuel: 450 kg
Trip fuel: 10200 kg
Passengers (adults each 84 kg): 115
Passengers (children each 35 kg): 6
Flight crew (each 85 kg): 2
Cabin crew (each 75 kg): 3
Standard baggage for each passenger: 13 kg
